display: let's start creating some memory data. what do you need to know form me to support me best?
ask me one question after another
i am web chapter lead. responsible for the websites within our componay. leading a team of 22 people. personal focus is full stack with clear focus on web. ai entusiast. devops included.
Astro, react, next.js, tanstack, typescript, fastify, graphql, tailwind, NX
prettier resp. oxfmt defaults. i don't care about this and let the formatter do there job
i don't practice TDD but tests are essentials and you can help me create them after building the functionality. mainly working with vitest, jest (in legacy projects) and playwright
orbit in the rms sub directory is the biggest project we work on. it's a monorepo and i'd like you to have a deeper look at it. eg scanning the AGENTS.md file.

we work with PRs on github. these are squash merged. branch names are follow the pattern feature/<jira ticket number>-<description> eg feature/PNT-1234-fix-something-important. commit messages i normally just use emojis because of the squash mergin afterwards. do never commit to the main branch but always branch away first when starting a new task. on orbit we leverage changeset to version our packages. anything else you need to know?
brief and direct. act autonomously but i prefer to start in plan mode so we can look and discuss solutions up front. i treat you like a peer and this is the workflow we live up to
help me to configure you the best way possible to assist me. suggest setup and skills or plugins etc
add and configure all of them
anything else you need to store in your memory or are we ready for now?
where is my account usage limit coming from and are the limits adjustable?

i've installed the claude chrome extension. can you connect to a website i have open in chrome and analyze it from a performance perspective? my goal is, that you suggest optimizations and apply the findings in this repository
i've entered the url in your tab group

fonts are preloaded via early hints and link header. therefore i don't see the need to do it in head again, right? continue with the implementation regarding CMP and htmx. create a new branch first called feature/PNT-XXX-perf-improvements

CLAUDE.md        history.jsonl    projects         settings.json    stats-cache.json tasks            todos
write a gitignore file i can re-use
just print it here in the terminal

what about the debug folder on .claude dir? sync it or igniore it?
when working with CMPs: whats the best loading behaviour for it's scripts? blocking, non blocking, async, defered, etc
we use onetrust (https://www.onetrust.com/). what optimizations do you see for this provider?

validate if this plan would work as well. we store the file as suggested in libs/layout/vendor/otSDKStub.js. but instead of moving it the the public folder, we import it and let using the astro bundling? we don't have to put it into the public directory that way and it's available on all apps since orbit.rms.rocks is the main application
i thought about adding mermaid diagrams of key aspects to this repo to make it easier understandable for you. what are your thoughts about it?

i want to add a key point of our app handling to our AGENTS.md files and also to your MEMORY.md file. we knwo two types of apps. publishing clients which are re-using the code in orbit.rms.rocks but apply there own theming, config, assets etc and have therefor no src directory. other apps also rely on orbit.rms.rocks but do have the chance to overwrite, extend also code and add features. check our implementation and add the key aspects for your to the mentioned files. ask if you need further clarification. draw mairmaid diagrams if that helps.
